channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Fire at Lithium Battery Plant in South Korea Kills at Least 22
item.description: The blaze was one of the country’s deadliest in recent years. Most of the victims were migrant workers from China.

item.title: Death Sentence Reversed for Iranian Rapper Toomaj Salehi, Lawyer Says
item.description: Toomaj Salehi had been sentenced to death in April after releasing music in support of antigovernment demonstrations two years ago.

item.title: After fiery 2023 Norfolk Southern derailment left firefighters in dark about chemicals on the train, railroads must now immediately offer hazardous cargo details
item.description: Too often in past disasters like last year's fiery Norfolk Southern derailment in East Palestine, Ohio, firefighters risked their lives trying to extinguish a blaze without knowing the right way to respond.

item.title: The Promise of Weight-Loss Drugs
item.description: Where these drugs might take us — and what that means for medicine.

item.title: Philippines Drops Charges Against Leila de Lima, Prominent Duterte Critic
item.description: Ms. de Lima, a former senator, was detained for six years on drug charges after fiercely criticizing then-President Rodrigo Duterte’s bloody war on drugs.

item.title: Europe’s richest man Bernard Arnault just bought a quirky 3-star Parisian bistro that makes $100 roast chicken
item.description: The Parisian bistro may be more low key than LVMH's other businesses, but it has hosted many A-listers visiting the French capital.

item.title: Former Colonies Want France Out. This African Nation Says, Bienvenue!
item.description: France is facing deep anticolonial resentment across Africa, but has found a partner in Rwanda, which is embracing French influence despite years of acrimony.

item.title: Death Toll in Dagestan Attack Rises, Officials Say
item.description: The attack in Dagestan targeted synagogues and Orthodox churches. Russian investigators called it an act of terrorism, but it was not immediately clear who was responsible.

item.title: ‘Uncertainty is underrated’: Here’s the real reason markets reward those who stick around
item.description: You may not only be underestimating uncertainty—you may also be underestimating the positive impact of embracing it.

item.title: Biden Attacks Trump on Abortion, and an Illicit Hajj Industry
item.description: Plus, the soaring costs of caring for pets.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Israel’s Defense Minister Holds Talks in Washington on War’s Next Phase
item.description: Yoav Gallant said his meetings with top U.S. officials this week would involve the Gaza war’s “transition” to a new stage.

item.title: Forget STEM. Head of Paris’s top tech university says the secret to France’s AI boom is a focus on the humanities
item.description: The provost of Bernard Arnault and Mistral founder Arthur Mensch's college wants students to be well-rounded.

item.title: Crews Race to Fortify Levees as Floods Swallow Midwestern Towns
item.description: Officials in Iowa, South Dakota and Minnesota reported widespread damage over the weekend. In some places, the worst was still to come.

item.title: Fire at Lithium Battery Plant in South Korea Kills at Least 22
item.description: The blaze was one of the country’s deadliest in recent years. Most of the victims were migrant workers from China.

item.title: Danone and Nestle search for a way around Ozempic Revolution with high protein yogurt and vitamins against hair-loss
item.description: About 30 million Americans have taken GLP-1 drugs, sparking consumption shifts with ripple effects on retail, travel and beyond.
